title: Update changelog and add CI badges
body:
## Summary
- update CHANGELOG with real notes
- show status badges for GitHub Actions

## Testing
- `python -m pytest` *(fails: No module named pytest)*

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Added bulk caption management via TSV import/export.
  - Introduced configuration backup and restore capabilities.
  - Added system status and log viewing pages with real-time log streaming and enhanced filtering.
  - Enabled Google Cast support and integrations with Blue Iris, Home Assistant, and Hubitat.
  - Added custom video controls including Play All and Stop All.
  - Implemented automatic camera group loading and API discovery with paginated log view.
  - Added LLM summary generation with email alerts and capture time tracking for templates.
  - Configured FFprobe path settings.

- **Improvements**
  - Enhanced screenshot reliability and camera list UI.
  - Improved video player controls and updated package requirements.
  - Cleaned up code imports and updated repository URLs in the footer.

- **Bug Fixes**
  - Resolved Python build issues, string concatenation errors, screenshot timeouts, and setup script problems.

- **Documentation**
  - Updated the changelog with detailed descriptions of new features, improvements, and fixes.
  - Added workflow status badges (Python application, Pylint, Pyre) to the README for improved project visibility.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**

- **Bug Fixes**

  - Added a prerequisite check script to verify system dependencies before starting the application.
  - The application now automatically opens the setup page in the browser upon launch.

- **Documentation**
  - Expanded and clarified installation instructions with a new "Quick Start" section and explicit prerequisite check step.

- **Enhancements**
  - Generated passwords are now displayed to users when created automatically.
  - Improved application startup flow and error handling for port conflicts.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**

- **Documentation**
  - Updated API documentation to clarify that the video endpoint streams and loops the video instead of providing a direct download.
- **Tests**

title: Add optional S3 config backup support
body:
## Summary
- allow specifying AWS credentials via env/DB settings

- note cloud backup feature in README
- add boto3 to dependencies

## Testing
- `pytest -q`

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Added optional cloud backup capability, allowing configuration backups to be uploaded to an S3 bucket if AWS credentials are provided.
  - Configuration restore now supports downloading backups from S3 if local files are missing and AWS credentials are set.

- **Documentation**
  - Updated user and configuration guides to describe new cloud backup options and required AWS environment variables.

- **Chores**
  - Added the boto3 library as a dependency for AWS integration.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

- **Documentation**

title: Add user model and database-backed authentication
body:
## Summary
- add `User` ORM model and create users table
- use DB-backed authentication storing `user_id` in session
- extend credential generator to populate users table
- update tests for new login behavior
- document user accounts and role support

## Testing
- `pytest -q`

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Introduced a database-backed user management system with a dedicated users table, supporting usernames, password hashes, and user roles.
  - Login, logout, and authentication now operate using database-stored user accounts instead of static credentials.

- **Bug Fixes**
  - Improved session handling and user authentication checks for enhanced security and reliability.

- **Documentation**
  - Updated guides to reflect the new user management system and provide troubleshooting steps for user account issues.

- **Tests**
  - Enhanced test coverage and updated authentication tests to align with the new database-backed user system.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Add role-based user management
body:
## Summary
- add support for creating users with roles
- enforce roles via `login_required` and new `admin_required`
- add `/users` management routes and templates
- seed default roles with migration script
- document multi-user feature
- test new credential generation and role checks

## Testing
- `flake8 app/routes.py generate_credentials.py tests/test_generate_credentials.py tests/test_roles.py migrations/add_default_roles.py | head`
- `pytest tests/test_roles.py tests/test_generate_credentials.py -q`

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Introduced multi-user management with role enforcement, allowing administrators to add, edit, and delete users with assigned roles ("admin" or "viewer").
  - Added user management interface accessible via the application, including forms for creating and editing users.
  - Implemented role-based access control, restricting sensitive actions and settings to administrators only.

- **Documentation**
  - Updated guides and documentation to reflect new user roles, management features, and migration steps.
  - Added instructions for using the new user management interface and command-line utilities.

- **Bug Fixes**
  - Improved validation and processing for file uploads in caption management.

  - Added Linux support for updating Chrome shortcuts, allowing modification of `.desktop` files in addition to Windows shortcuts.
  - Success and error feedback is now visually indicated on the patch button, with corresponding messages and color highlights.
- **Bug Fixes**
  - Improved detection and handling of Chrome shortcuts needing updates on both Windows and Linux platforms.
- **Documentation**
  - Enhanced instructions for using the Chrome shortcut patching feature, including platform-specific details and clearer restart guidance.
- **Tests**
  - Added tests to verify Linux shortcut patching functionality.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
